revised_title: Gravity Waves in Flowing Water: Linear and Non-Linear Theories
tldr: This article examines the effect of a non-uniform current on two-dimensional gravity waves in flowing water. It considers linear and non-linear theories, finding that the velocity of wave propagation can be determined in terms of ascending powers of the square root of the Froude number. The non-linear waves are also analyzed, deriving the solitary and cnoidal wave solutions to a first approximation.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Fluid Dynamics
